questions.full_question_text: An aeroplane is on an IFR flight. The flight is to be changed from IFR to VFR. Is it possible?
options: No, you have to remain IFR in accordance to the filed flight plan
No, only ATC can order you to do this.
Yes, the pilot in command must inform ATC using the phrase 'cancelling my IFR flight'.
Yes, but only with permission from ATC.
questions.solution: Yes, the pilot in command must inform ATC using the phrase 'cancelling my IFR flight'.

questions.full_question_text: Which of the following is obligating for members of ICAO?
options: ICAO must be informed about differences from the standards in any of the Annexes to the convention
ICAO shall approve the pricing of tickets on international airline connections
ICAO must be informed about changes in the national regulations
ICAO must be informed about new flight crew licenses and any suspended validity of such licenses
questions.solution: ICAO must be informed about differences from the standards in any of the Annexes to the convention

questions.full_question_text: Any contracting state may denounce the Convention of Tokyo by notification addressed to:
options: the other Contracting States
International Civil Aviation Organisation
United Nations
to all States Members of United Nations

questions.full_question_text: Concerning to RNP (Required Navigation Performance) types, the indication RNP 4, represents a navigation accuracy of
options: plus or minus 4 NM on a 90 per cent containment basis
plus or minus 4 NM on a 95 per cent containment basis
plus or minus 4 NM on a 98 per cent containment basis
plus or minus 4 miles on a 90 per cent containment basis
questions.solution: plus or minus 4 NM on a 95 per cent containment basis

questions.full_question_text: Change from IFR to VFR will always take place:
options: at the clearance limit, irrespective of the weather conditions
on the initiative of the aircraft commander
as instructed by an air traffic control unit
when the aircraft is leaving controlled airspace during VMC
questions.solution: on the initiative of the aircraft commander
